message: DustJS - Asynchronous templates for the browser and node.js: http://akdubya.github.com/dustjs/
StringTemplate - Logic-less templates for Java: http://www.stringtemplate.org/
rules: one message - one link/project. no discussion here (rather open a new topic and publish the link here)

Excellent paper related to StringTemplate: "Enforcing Strict Model-View Separation in
Template Engines" - http://www.cs.usfca.edu/~parrt/papers/mvc.templates.pdf
MinimalJS - HTML+JSON template engine in JS: https://github.com/ruidlopes/minimal.js
Slim - Lightweight Haml-ish template engine in Ruby: http://slim-lang.com/
Haml - Markup haiku in Ruby: http://haml-lang.com/
Erubis - fast and awesome ERB implementation: http://www.kuwata-lab.com/erubis/
Jaml - Haml-ish engine in Node.js: http://jade-lang.com/
Handlebars.js - Extension to Mustache by Yehuda Katz: http://handlebars.strobeapp.com/
Google Closure Templates - Language independent templates that compile to js functions: http://code.google.com/closure/templates/
json-template - Minimal templating using JSON dictionary's: http://json-template.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/doc/Introducing-JSON-Template.html
Enlive - a selector-based (à la CSS) templating and transformation system for Clojure: https://github.com/cgrand/enlive
Pure - Simple and ultra-fast templating tool to generate HTML from JSON data: http://beebole.com/pure/
I have just done a simple alternative way to javascript template engine, called Tog. please check www.tog2html.com
Heist - An xhtml-based templating engine, allowing Haskell functions to be bound to XML tags. https://github.com/snapframework/heist
